security: Disclosing the methods of obtaining information from agents through the mails (as mentioned in paragraph 1) could compromise intelligence gathering techniques and endanger the agents involved. Specifically, revealing that AMCORE-2 obtained a document through the mails from Agent 1995 could expose both AMCORE-2 and Agent 1995 to increased scrutiny.
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of Station, JMWAVE, reports that AMCORE-2 delivered a sketch of battalion defensive positions obtained via mail from Agent 1995, also known as Modesto VENTOSO Mendes.
summary_one_paragraph: On August 2, 1963, the Chief of Station at JMWAVE sent a confidential dispatch to the Chief of the Special Affairs Staff (SAS) regarding AMCORE-2's delivery of a sketch depicting battalion defensive positions. The sketch, obtained through the mails from Agent 1995, also identified as Modesto VENTOSO Mendes, was received by AMCORE-2's Case Officer on August 16, 1963, and the letter containing it was postmarked April 15, 1963. The dispatch indicates that the sketch shows the defensive arrangement of a battalion-sized force, with three companies positioned on the line and a fourth held in reserve.
title: INTEL/TYPIC - AMCORE 2 Production Deployment Sketch of Battalion Defensive Positions
